name: THE (DIY) CRACK PACK
description: the 25% off code will not be honored on the crack pack That's right, kids. Build your own Crack Pack! Choose: One 12" LP: Day Joy or Hollagramz One 12" EP: Hands or Gracie One 10" EP: Supreme Cuts or High Highs Three 7"s: Guards, Campfires, Idiot Glee, TV Girl, Gracie, Francisco The Man, Day Joy, Night Panther, Hundred Waters Just leave your instructions in the Pay Pal notes or via email to smallplatesrecs@gmail.com

name: Night Panther - Delta // Fire 7" (SPR017B)
description: Limited to 500 copies on gold vinyl. Shipping September 17th. Press: "We're are dead in the heat of summer and it feels like the sex pop boys are back to save us." - Yours Truly "Night Panther continue to make music great for both sunny day drives and late night mood-setting." - Pigeons and Planes "We're digging it." - Pretty Much Amazing

name: SXSW Promo Flexi 7"
description: This limited edition 7" flexi was initially handed out to the attendees of our killer SXSW Showcase with Father/Daughter and Gold Robot Records. We now have a very limited number in-stock for your consumption. Features unreleased tracks by Gracie, Monster Rally, and The Everywheres. This pressing was limited to 500.

name: Gracie - Bleeder EP (Digital Only)
description: The new EP from Gracie. Available as PAY WHAT YOU WANT VIA BANDCAMP and digitally via all ur favorite online retailers. Pay $8 or more via Bandcamp and receive a free copy of the Habits / Creature Pleaser 7". Just forward shipping instructions. iTunes Bandcamp

name: Hollagramz - Hollagramz LP (SPR016)
description:
Coming soon. June 4th, 2013.

Limited to 300 on purple vinyl. Vinyl comes with digital download codes.

Press:

“Hollagramz just wants to take us on a trip…we’ve got a layover somewhere between space dust way and the chill room.” – Fader

“solidly funky, forward-looking dance cuts.” – XLR8R

“Sex Potion. It’s a roaring, bass-heavy storm of synth stabs, rattles and claps – in essence, a pop-up rave” – Dummy Mag

name: Francisco The Man - In The Corners 7" (SPR015)
description:
3 brand new tracks of sun-burned, acid-fried rock chaos from one of LA's best up and comers. 500 copies available on Coke Bottle Green vinyl. Side A: In The Corners Side B: 929 // Taking Punches

Press:

"[Taking Punches] reminds us of My Bloody Valentine...but they take the Loveless aesthetic and filter it through their own experience, giving it new life and fresh relevance." - Pretty Much Amazing

"[In The Corners] reads like dynamic and catchy raucousness, and is satisfying on a whole bunch of levels..." - The Music Ninja

"[Francisco The Man] effectively mesh static, reverbed instrumentation with sun-kissed, beach rock guitar riffs to create hazy, laid back, and infectious tunes." - Prefix

"Broken Arrows begins as innocent, pastoral indie only to erupt into an awesomely caterwauling, Doug Martsch- styled guitar assault. As misdirections go, they rarely come more jolting or effective." - NME

name: Gracie - Habits / Creature Pleaser 7" (SPR014)
description:
Small Plates' second helping from Brooklyn's Gracie comes in the form of the Habits / Creature Pleaser 7". Straight up killer Electronic Garage-Pop jams for the New Year. Limited to 500. All orders come with a free download of the Bleeder EP. Previously available Gracie via SPR: Treehouse 12" Press: " the perfect soundtrack to that heart thumping day dream you can’t wait to come true..." - Yours Truly "Habits is easily one of the best tracks I’ve heard in quite some time. Dare I say, this song is perfect..." - Portals "[Creature Pleaser] bounces and cavorts, moving away from synthpop and towards synth-rock, while Andrew Balasia’s voice reaches stratospheric heights..." - The Key XPN Stalk Gracie:

Facebook

Twitter

Soundcloud

name: Day Joy - Go To Sleep Mess LP (SPR011)
description:
We are ecstatic to bring you the Go To Sleep Mess LP from Orlando's Day Joy.

We've pressed only 500 copies, 150 on Coke Bottle Green vinyl. The first 100 orders will come with an 8 x 11 Day Joy poster, custom designed by the band and SPR.

Tracklist:

Side A:

Animal Noise - Bone and Bloody - Talks of Terror - Walking Home - Purple

Side B:

CCD - Melting - Everything is Going To Last - Splattered Like Me - Go To Sleep, Mess

Press

"The Orlando, Florida duo Day Joy filter their deceptively simple, backwoods folk-pop through a smeared, dreamy lens – the end product is sweet, soft, and confessional, with a compellingly strange layer of otherworldly, David Lynch-ian creepiness that manifests in massive, swarming sounds that seem to bubble up from nowhere." -Pretty Much Amazing "Truly elegant and heartbreaking lyricisms yank DAY JOY from beneath the ho-hum alt-country umbrella out into heartily-crafted folk sunlight." -Paste "Michael Serrin and Peter Michael Perceval craft haunting folk music with bursts of noise-pop and rock" -Obscure Sound "Do yourself a favor and get lost in their music." -Earmilk "The full, sweet sounding dream you hear before you started on porches, and gradually grew through living rooms, microphones, condensers, and more." -Smoke Don't Smoke

name: Hundred Waters 7" (SPR013)
description: One of our most anticipated releases of the new year is this stunning 7" release by Gainesville's Hundred Waters, the band's first 7" release. The a-side hosts a lovely, organic alternate take of "Visitors" while the b features a Nicole Miglis solo version of "Caverns". This is a very limited, one-time co-release with our friends at OWSLA. Get yours before it disappears into the ether forever. Pressed on milky transparent vinyl. The jackets are stamped with beautiful black raven foil ink. Yours Truly was on hand to record "Caverns". Watch here » Both songs were produced by Jason Finkel at Stadium Red in Harlem. Note: this item is a preorder and will ship in late April 2013.

name: Day Joy - Go To Sleep, Mess 7" (SPR012)
description:
A precursor to the Go To Sleep Mess LP out February 12th, the 7" record includes the "Go To Sleep, Mess" single and the non-album cut, "Destroyer", on the B-side. These beauts are a limited pressing with the first 150 comin' hard at you on bone colored vinyl. All preorders will ship before December 25th! The Press: "Truly elegant and heartbreaking lyricisms yank DAY JOY from beneath the ho-hum alt-country umbrella out into heartily-crafted folk sunlight." - Paste "Do yourself a favor and get lost in their music." - Earmilk "...hauntingly beautiful folk that’s right on the line between good dream and subtle nightmare." - Pretty Much Amazing"

Stalk Day Joy:

Facebook

Twitter

Tumblr

Bandcamp

name: Francisco The Man - Tiger 7" (SPR010)
description:
We've kept quite busy scouring the alleyways and mini-marts of Los Angeles, CA for a new ass kicker and are psyched to say we've unearthed a definte bruiser in Francisco The Man.

It's also our 10th release. Plenty of reasons to get psyched.

The rowdy, beachy vibes of Tiger swamp side-A, while the acid-tinged rawk of Broken Arrows blows up side-B.

We've pressed 500 of these bad boys, the first 150 are on transparent blue wax and they are primed for preorder. The batch ships August 7th.

Buy Digitally: [iTunes] [Amazon] [eMusic]

The Press:

"[Francisco The Man] effectively mesh static, reverbed instrumentation with sun-kissed, beach rock guitar riffs to create hazy, laid back, and infectious tunes." - Prefix

"Broken Arrows begins as innocent, pastoral indie only to erupt into an awesomely caterwauling, Doug Martsch- styled guitar assault. As misdirections go, they rarely come more jolting or effective." - NME

“[Broken Arrows] is a cinematic 6-minute excursion with the expansiveness of Band of Horses” – Buzzbands LA

“...feel-good kind of rock & roll. The surfer aesthetic paired with sixties AM...”– Friends With Both Arms

“ [It’s] ambitious rock... the type of rock that is too small for usual clubs, that sounds widescreen enough to fill the space of big arenas.” – We All Want Someone

Stalk Francisco The Man:

Facebook

Twitter

Tumblr

name: Hands - Massive Context EP 12" (SPR009)
description:
We are thrilled to give you SPR009, Hands' Massive Context EP. This is the first physical release from these LA rock demons, and with 6 tracks coming in at just shy of 30 minutes, it's a labor of love for the band, label, and anyone within earshot. We've got 300 pressed on beautiful transparent orange/red vinyl, and... If vinyl isn't your bag, or your '03 Honda Civic doesn't have that AUX port, we've got these Hands on CD too. Get 'em while they're hot. Now shipping. If digital is your game, you can grab it at all relavent online shops »

iTunes

Amazon

Press:

“...exudes the same kind of emotional sheen as Thom Yorke’s solo work...” -Buzzbands LA

“big claps, echoed vocals, massively layered melodies and driving beats...[Hands]is anything but "just another Los Angeles band."” – Filter

“There are often intangibles with bands, when you like them. You just know it. You can just like. We found that Hands does that to us and will likely do that for you too.”- Daytrotter

name: Gracie - Treehouse LP + T-Shirt + Digital Download Bundle
description:
Get the album and the tee for a reduced price.

Digital download card included.

name: Gracie T-Shirt + Digital Download
description: All shirts come with a digital download code for the Treehouse EP. 90% Cotton. 10% Polyester. 100% from Philly. www.shirtstoop.com Comes in Mens S, M, L.

name: Field Mouse - "You Guys Are Gonna Wake Up My Mom" 7" (SPR008)
description:
Small Plates is proud to announce SPR008, a 7” dish from Brooklyn shoegaze-pop heroes, Field Mouse.

The hazy sweetness of “You Guys Are Gonna Wake Up My Mom” fogs up the A-side, while the heavy guitar squall of “Happy” soaks the B.

300 copies on clear vinyl, now shipping.

Buy Digitally:

iTunes | emusic | Amazon

The Press:

“…gorgeously atmospheric shoegaze-pop…” – The Deli Mag NYC

“To say this is a beautifully lush dream of a song doesn’t quite do it justice.” – This Music Doesn’t Suck

“…lush sonic textures and expansive soundscapes…” – Music Emissions

“It’s hard to decide what to get lost in, the distorted fuzziness, or the wondrous vocals of lead singer Rachel Browne. Just go for both…” – We All Want Someone

"[Field Mouse] shimmer like Velocity Girl used to do back in the early ’90s..." - Stereogum

Stalk Field Mouse:

Facebook

Twitter

Tumblr

name: Gracie - Treehouse 12" (SPR007)
description:
Small Plates grows up with its first 12" from Philadelphia, PA's Gracie.

His Treehouse EP channels a darker spirit than his previous efforts, and for this we are grateful. Often brooding, always sexy, Gracie's downbeat electro-R n' B will surely guide you warmly through winter's darkest tunnels.

We have pressed the first 100 copies on gold vinyl to light your path.

Tracklist

A1: Sisters A2: Southern Place A3: Tryck R Treat B1: Candii B2: Playpen

Buy Digitally

iTunes | Amazon | emusic

Press: "...suave downtempo electropop..." - The Key WXPN

"...it should attract utter love from as many people as it alienates." - One Thirty BPM

"... deep r&b stabs all flexed around Andrew Balasia's insanely fragile and haunting soft-spoken vocals." - BIRP! FM

"...chills inducing, haunting...a bedroom ready burner." - Prefix

Stalk Gracie:

Facebook

Twitter

Soundcloud

name: High Highs - High Highs EP (SPR006)
description:
Ultra-limited vinyl release: First 100 copies come on marbled charcoal-gray wax. Preorder now: orders will arrive on or before the November 22nd release date. High Highs High Highs 10" EP SPR006 A1: "Open Season" A2: "Flowers Bloom" B3: "Ivy" B4: "Horses"

“ruminative, dreamlike pop, rich with falsetto harmonies and nuanced electronic glaze.” – Spinner “…an immediately endearing slice of indie-pop…” - NPR “…airy, harmony-laden indie pop…” - Pitchfork

name: TV Girl - Girls Like Me 7" (SPR005)
description:
We are absolutely stoked to announce the release of TV Girl's "Girls Like Me" 7", the first physical release from these stellar Californians. Limited to 500 copies, 150 of which come on hella yellow wax, these two songs are sure to be your autumn 2011 anthems- pure pop perfection.

"Girls Like Me" graces the A-side, while "Sarah (Meet Me In The Sauna)" adorns the B.

“…champagne-sparkling drums and far-away piano drops… bring to mind Jens Lekman…” – Pitchfork

“…shimmering, lo-fi dream pop with a slightly racy undercurrent.”- The Guardian

“On TV Girl’s new EP there’s a …feeling of sugary sweet nostalgia and more modern backbeat production”- Stereogum

name: Supreme Cuts "Trouble EP" (SPR004)
description:
The first 10" in the Small Plates arsenal comes from Chicago's future R 'n' B champs, Supreme Cuts. The "Trouble EP", pressed in a limited edition of 500 (first 100 orders on sexy-as-hell pink wax), includes 4 tracks of mind-numbing bangers hell bent on making you shake your ass. "Amnesia" and "Months" are on the A-side while "Fools" and "Issues" fill up the B.

All vinyl orders come with digital download code.

“A…seamless mash of sultry vocals and post-dub beats.” – Fader

“A morphine drip for the ears…” – Weird Magic

“Present-day ravers will age into the future’s amnesiacs and this will soundtrack their descent.”– Altered Zones

"...one of Chicago's best new things...the future of R 'n' B."- Chicagoist

Download on iTunes

name: Idiot Glee - Don't Go Out Tonight 7" (SPR003)
description: James Friley and Idiot Glee, one in the same, now immortalized, sphericized, and pressed real hard onto the silky smooth surface of vinyl. Idiot Glee's "Don't Go Out Tonight" 7" is Small Plates' latest release, a one-of-a-kind release featuring the title track on the a-side, and a very special double b-side featuring "That’s All For Everyone" (Fleetwood Mac Cover) and a live performance of "Don't Drink The Water" featuring Women. "Don't Go Out Tonight" 7" is now shipping on deliciously creamy white vinyl. "One of the best voices around in 2010..." -- NME "Idiot Glee lives somewhere between Jens Lekman’s thoughtful crooning and the classic auteur-pop of Brian Wilson or even Another Green World’s Brian Eno." -- VICE "He’s out-and-out in love with music, possessing that weird, romantic longing that the best stuff brings out in even the steeliest soul." -- Time Out New York

name: Campfires - Dusty Mansions 7" (SPR002)
description: We're ridiculously excited to announce the second release on Small Plates: a three-track helping from Chicago's Jeff Walls, better known as Campfires. "Dusty Mansions" is on the a-side, while the double b-side has "Time Flying By" and "Chasing Planets" Limited to 500 copies on red vinyl. Shit is fierce. Now shipping! "If you're into Arthur/Lola-era Kinks (and who isn't?) with a charmingly lo-fi psych-pop infusion, then this is carved out especially for you." - Prefix "There’s something loving in each of his tracks, rather than the coldness of his more dubby counterparts. It’s, quite aptly, music to get cosy to." - Neu Magazine "A rich patchwork of wooly-warm guitar wrapping and falcetto’d mantras of melancholy." - Transparent

name: Guards - Resolution of One 7" (SPR001)
description: We're psyched to launch Small Plates with three tracks from NYC-based Guards. "Resolution of One" is the a-side, and the double b-side has "Crystal Truth" and "Long Time". Limited to 500 copies on gorgeous mixed-color vinyl. Now shipping!. "mysterious essayers of dark and sludgily excellent new [music]" - The Washington Post "deliciously undeniable [...] perfect hooks and howls." - MTV Music "tooth-ache sweet, common cold catchy, parallel universe pop" - Yours Truly / Altered Zones
